file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 28-22-03-05 - CONFIG-1 - APU FUEL FEED LINE SHROUD - ADJUSTMENT/TEST

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL APU FUEL FEED LINE SHROUD - ADJUSTMENT/TEST EFFECTIVITY: ACFT MODEL(S) EMB-145 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to do a test on the APU fuel-feed-line shroud for leakage. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ACFT MODEL(S) APU FUEL-FEED-LINE SHROUD - OP- 28-22-03-700-801-A ♦ EMB-145 ERATIONAL TEST EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General CONFIG-1 28-22-03 Page 1 of 10 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 28-22-03-700-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ACFT MODEL(S) EMB-145 2. APU FUEL-FEED-LINE SHROUD - OPERATIONAL TEST A. General (1) The function of this test is to make sure that there is no leakage in the connections of the APU fuel-feed-line shroud. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - AMM MPP 06-41-02/100 - AMM MPP 06-42-00/100 - AMM MPP 28-00-00/200 - MAINTENANCE PRACTICES AMM MPP 28-00-01/400 - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 155 155FZ LH wing stub 155 155GZ LH wing stub 156 156FZ RH wing stub 156 156GZ RH wing stub 312 312AR Tail cone compartment D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY To pressurize the engine fuel-feed-line GSE 080 Box, leakage test shroud To connect the leakage test box to the APU GSE 115 Hose assembly fuel-feed-line shroud drain To connect the leakage test box to the APU GSE 116 Hose assembly fuel-feed-line shroud drain E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Brush To apply leak detection fluid 1 available Commercially Plug, AS 5168 D08 or equivalent To close the APU-fuel-feed line 1 available Commercially Rubber hose - 25.4 mm (1 in) in diame- To close the APU fuel-feed-line shroud 1 available ter/300 mm (18 in) in length Commercially Union, AS 5174 D0404, or equivalent To connect the pressure line 1 available EMB-145 - AMM 1285 700-801-A/500 CONFIG-1 28-22-03 Page 2 of 10 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (Continued) ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Sleeve, MS 20819 - 4D, or equivalent To connect the pressure line 1 available Commercially Tee, AS 1039 W040404, or equivalent To connect the pressure line 1 available Commercially Flared tube, AL 5052 - 6.35 mm (1/4 in) To connect the pressure line 1 available in diameter/101 mm (4 in) in length Commercially Nut, AN 818 - 4D, or equivalent To connect the pressure line 1 available Commercially Clamp NAS 1922-0100-1H or similar To attach the hose to the APU shroud 2 available Available in the operator's inven- Cap To close the hose 1 tories Commercially Plug Close the APU fuel-feed line 1 available F. Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) Leak Tec No. 16 MIL-L-25567 or equivalent AR G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE Tail cone compartment/wing stub/passen- 1 Does the task ger cabin/baggage compartment/rear elec- tronic compartment I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-010-A (1) Remove access panels 155FZ, 155GZ, 156FZ and 156GZ (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100) to get access to the APU fuel-feed-line shroud drain fitting. WARNING: BEFORE YOU DO THE TASK, OBEY THE SAFETY PRECAUTIONS GIVEN IN AMM MPP 28-00-00/200 TO PREVENT INJURY TO PERSONS AND DAMAGE TO THE MATERIAL. (2) Open access panel 312AR (AMM MPP 06-42-00/100) to get access to the APU fuel- feed line in the tail cone compartment. (3) On the circuit breaker panel, open these circuit breakers and attach a DO-NOT- CLOSE tag to them: • STAR 1/2. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 700-801-A/500 CONFIG-1 28-22-03 Page 3 of 10 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL • FUEL PUMPS 1A/1B/1C. • FUEL PUMPS 2A/2B/2C. • APU CONTROL. • APU FUEL SOV. (4) Disconnect the APU fuel-feed line in the tail cone compartment and install the plug (3) to close the APU fuel-feed line. (5) Close the line shroud with the hose (4), plug (2), and clamps (1). (6) Release the clamp (8) and remove the APU fuel-feed-line hose drain in the wing stub. (7) Before you connect the leakage test box to the APU line shroud, do the steps below to adjust the leakage test box (Figure 501): (a) Make sure that there is no moisture and no foreign matter in the inlet filter of the leakage test box. (b) Install a hose to connect the AIR OUTLET coupling to the MANOMETRIC PRESSURE coupling on the LH side of the leakage test box. (c) Turn the pressure regulator knob fully counterclockwise (-). (d) Keep the pressure source selector in the CLOSE position. CAUTION: MAKE SURE THAT THE REGULATOR KNOB IS FULLY CLOSED IN THE COUNTERCLOCKWISE POSITION BEFORE YOU CONNECT THE SHOP-AIR/BOTTLE INLET. IF YOU DO NOT OBEY THIS PROCEDURE DAMAGE TO THE EQUIPMENT CAN OCCUR (e) Connect a source of compressed air to AIR INLET coupling on the leakage test box. (f) Turn the pressure source selector to the AIR position. (g) Move the operation selector lever to the PRESSURE position and turn the pressure regulator knob clockwise (+) until you get an indication of 1.5 psi on the pressure gauge. (h) Turn the pressure source selector to the CLOSE position. (i) Push the operation selector lever to the ESCAPE position until the pressure gauge shows zero. (j) Remove the hose that connect the AIR OUTLET coupling to the MANOMETRIC PRESSURE coupling. (8) Install the hoses (4) and (5) and connect the leakage test box to the APU-fuel-line shroud drain. See Figure 501 to assemble the hoses. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 700-801-A/500 CONFIG-1 28-22-03 Page 4 of 10 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL J. Operationally Check APU Fuel-Feed-Line Shroud (Figure 502) SUBTASK 710-010-A CAUTION: TOO MUCH PRESSURE CAN CAUSE STRUCTURAL DAMAGE TO THE SHROUD. USE ONLY THE SPECIFIED PRESSURE VALUE (1.5 PSI) TO DO THE TEST. (1) On the leakage test box, turn the pressure source selector to the AIR position. (2) Move the selector lever of the leakage test box to the PRESSURE position and turn the pressure regulator knob clockwise until the pressure reaches 1.5 psi. (3) When the pressure becomes stable at 1.5 psi, release test box lever and turn the source selector to the CLOSE position. (4) Monitor the pressure value for the next 10 (ten) min. The pressure value must be stable. Use a chronometer if necessary. (5) If, during the check, the pressure does not stay at the test value, do the steps from (a) to (h) to repair the leakage: (a) Move the test box lever to the ESCAPE position, until the pressure gauge shows zero. (b) Remove these access panels to get access to the APU fuel-feed-line shroud: 1 Passenger cabin • 251HF/261DF/261BF (AMM MPP 06-41-02/100). 2 Baggage compartment • 271AF/271BF/271CF (AMM MPP 06-41-02/100). 3 Rear electronic compartment • 271DF/271EF (AMM MPP 06-41-02/100). (c) Move the selector lever of the leakage test box to the PRESSURE position and apply pressure into the shroud line until you have the test value. (d) Use a brush to apply the leak detection fluid to the shroud fittings and examine them for leakage. (e) If there are leaks, identify the related area(s). (f) Move the test box lever to the ESCAPE position, until the pressure gauge shows zero. (g) Repair the shroud as necessary to remove the leak(s). Do the check again and make sure that there is no leak. (h) Install all the panels (AMM MPP 06-41-02/100) removed in step (b). (6) Move the test box lever to the ESCAPE position, until the pressure gauge shows zero. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 700-801-A/500 CONFIG-1 28-22-03 Page 5 of 10 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL K. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-010-A (1) On the test box turn the pressure regulator knob fully counterclockwise (-). (2) Remove the hoses (4) and (5) and disconnect the leakage test box from the APU shroud drain. (3) Disconnect the source of compressed air from AIR INLET coupling of the leakage test box. (4) Install the drain hose of the APU-fuel-feed line shroud in the wing stub. (5) Remove the hose (4), plug (2), and clamps (1) from the APU fuel-feed-line shroud. (6) Remove the plug (3) from the APU fuel-feed line. (7) Connect the APU fuel line (AMM MPP 28-00-01/400). (8) On the circuit breaker panel, close these circuit breakers and remove the tag from them: • STAR 1/2. • FUEL PUMPS 1A/1B/1C. • FUEL PUMPS 2A/2B/2C. • APU CONTROL. • APU FUEL SOV. (9) Set the APU master switch to ON. (10) Set the applicable fuel pump to on and do a check for leaks at the fuel hose. (11) Set the applicable fuel pump to off. (12) Set the APU master switch to OFF. (13) Install access panels 155FZ, 155GZ, 156FZ and 156GZ (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). (14) Install access panel 312AR (AMM MPP 06-42-00/100). (15) Put the aircraft back to its usual configuration. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 700-801-A/500 CONFIG-1 28-22-03 Page 6 of 10 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
